py_sim.tools.projections module¶

projections.py provides a series of functions for generating intersections and projections between line segments and points

class py_sim.tools.projections.LineCarrot(line: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]], s_dev_max: float, s_carrot: float = 0.0, s_prev: float = 0.0)¶

Bases: object

Given a line, this class stores the functionality for getting the point along the line that is closest to the robot plus some “carrot”/leading offset.

_line¶

The line that is being followed

Type:

npt.NDArray[Any]

_s_vals¶

Stores the distance along the line for each point on the line

_s_dev_max¶

The maximum allowed deviation from one query to the next

Type:

float

_s_carrot¶

The distance in front of the projection point to return

Type:

float

_s_prev¶

Stores the previous distance along the line

Type:

float

_ind_prev¶

Stores the index of the parent to the previous calculated point

Type:

int

get_carrot_point(point: TwoDArrayType) → TwoDimArray¶

Calculates a point projected onto _line at a distance of _s_carrot in front of the vehicle

Arg:

point: Point to be projected onto the line

Returns:

The carrot point (point _s_carrot in front of the projection point)

Return type:

TwoDimArray

py_sim.tools.projections.calculate_line_distances(line: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]]) → list[float]¶

Calculates the distance to each point on the line

Parameters:

line – 2xn matrix defining a line where each column is a point along the line

Returns:

The distance along the line to each point

Return type:

list[float]

py_sim.tools.projections.carrot_point(line: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]], s_vals: list[float], s_des: float, k_prev: int = 0) → ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]]¶

Get a point on the line at the distance of s_des along the line. Returns the final point if the line is shorter than s_des

Parameters:

  • line – 2xn matrix defining a line where each column is a point along the line

  • s_vals – length n list giving the distance along the line for each point

  • s_des – The point at the desired location

  • k_prev – A guess of the point on the line for the distance just smaller than s_des

Returns:

2x1 point along the line at s_des

Return type:

npt.NDArray[Any]

py_sim.tools.projections.find_closest_intersection(edge1: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]], edge_list: list[numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[Any]]]) → tuple[float, numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[Any]]] | None¶

Finds the closest intersection point between an edge and an edge list. Proximity is based on the location of the first point in edge 1

Parameters:

  • edge1 – 2x2 matrix of points where each point is a column

  • edge_list – list of 2x2 matrices consisting of edges

Returns:

Null if no intersection found (inter_dist, inter_point) if an intersection is found

inter_dist is the distance from the first point on edge 1 to the intersection point

inter_point: 2x1 matrix representing the position of intersection

Return type:

Optional[tuple[float, npt.NDArray[Any]]]

py_sim.tools.projections.line_segment_intersection(edge1: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]], edge2: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]]) → ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]] | None¶

Determines the intersection point of an two line segments or None if the intersection does not exist.

The intersection is found by determining the scaling along edge1 of the point of intersection

Parameters:

  • edge1 – 2x2 matrix of points where each point is a column

  • edge2 – 2x2 matrix of points where each point is a column

Returns:

None if no intersection exists, the intersection point as a column vector if it does

Return type:

Optional[npt.NDArray[Any]]

py_sim.tools.projections.project_point_to_edge(edge: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]], point: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]], s_min: float = 0.0, s_max: float = inf) → tuple[numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[Any]], float]¶

Finds the projection of the given point onto the linesegment defined by the edge

Parameters:

  • edge – 2x2 matrix of points where each point is a column

  • point – 2x1 matrix defining the cartesian representation of a point

  • s_min – The minimum path length distance along the segment

  • s_max – The maximum path length distance along the segment

Returns:

(proj, dist) The projection of the point onto the edge and the distance along the edge

proj: Projection point along the edge bounded by the edge vertices dist: Distance along the edge of the projected point

Return type:

tuple[npt.NDArray[Any], float]

py_sim.tools.projections.project_point_to_line(point: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]], line: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]], s_vals: list[float], s_min: float = 0.0, s_max: float = inf, k_prev: int = 0) → tuple[numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[Any]], float, int]¶

Finds the projection of the given point onto a linesegment defined by the path bound by the minimum and maximum path distance.

Parameters:

  • point – 2x1 matrix defining the cartesian representation of a point

  • line – 2xn matrix defining a line where each column is a point along the line

  • s_vals – length n list giving the distance along the line for each point

  • s_min – minimum distance allowed along the path

  • s_max – maximum distance allowed along the path

  • k_prev – the index from which to start within the line

Returns:

(proj, s_proj, k_prev)

proj: Projection point along the line

s_proj: The distance along the line of the projection point

k_prev: The index of the point on the line preceding the projection point

Return type:

tuple[npt.NDArray[Any], float, int]
